title: How to Set up a Computer

steps.headline: First, purchase a Desktop PC from companies such as Dell and PC World.
steps.description: Make sure that the PC does what you want it to do.

steps.headline: Next, open the box to find the components purchased with the desktop (monitor, mouse, keyboard).
After that, place the desktop where you think it should go (near or on a desk is good).
Now, connect the cables.
steps.description: You should have a VGA or DVI cable for the monitor, a 3.5 mm cable for the speakers, A PS/2 or USB cable for the keyboard and mouse and a power cable.

steps.headline: After that, connect everything to a extension cable and connect that to an AC outlet.

tyn: Peripherals such as monitors, speakers, keyboards and mouse
Optional extras such as cameras and iPods
text: First, purchase a Desktop PC from companies such as Dell and PC World. Make sure that the PC does what you want it to do. Next, open the box to find the components purchased with the desktop (monitor, mouse, keyboard).  After that, place the desktop where you think it should go (near or on a desk is good).  Now, connect the cables. You should have a VGA or DVI cable for the monitor, a 3.5 mm cable for the speakers, A PS/2 or USB cable for the keyboard and mouse and a power cable. After that, connect everything to a extension cable and connect that to an AC outlet.  Next, turn on the PC.  You're all set up!
sentences: First, purchase a Desktop PC from companies such as Dell and PC World.
Make sure that the PC does what you want it to do.
Next, open the box to find the components purchased with the desktop (monitor, mouse, keyboard).
After that, place the desktop where you think it should go (near or on a desk is good).
You should have a VGA or DVI cable for the monitor, a 3.5 mm cable for the speakers, A PS/2 or USB cable for the keyboard and mouse and a power cable.
After that, connect everything to a extension cable and connect that to an AC outlet.
